intro: Gastrolychnis sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East, particularly Sakhalin Island. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is a perennial herb that produces small, edible berries, which are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine and temperate flora.
